commenter_a: Actually, The founding fathers were rich aristocrats who valued property rights at a premium, so much so that they limited the right to vote to land owners, who at the time were the billionaires of their day. It isn't right that billionaires can buy elections, but that probably would have been the intention of the founding fathers.
post_message: When the Founding Fathers wrote the Constitution, I’m pretty sure they weren’t thinking “Let’s make sure billionaires can buy elections.”
